Problem:
Date Raised: 14 November Candidate Email: marciaang@hotmail.com Email Thread: IHRP Competency Assessment Details #78525 Context: Candidate reported to us that her assessment was terminated due to her network when she was attempting qn 17. We are checking on Prometric on the following: Under what circumstances would a candidate receive this error message? Is the assessment terminated when there is an internet disruption? If not, could you explain what might have happened during this candidate's attempt?

Evidence comments (id • author_role • date • text):
19647 • unknown • NaT • Points were answered as per Ankit from Prometric: Could you confirm the following points for us: Under what circumstances would a candidate receive this error message? This appears when the candidate does not have internet connectivity, and the popup appears with the Retry button. It will disappear when the candidate clicks on a Retry Button and if the internet is connected. Is the assessment terminated when there is an internet disruption? No System will not terminate, the popup will appear till the internet is not connected. If not, could you explain what might have happened during this candidate's attempt? All responses are saved in the backend until an internet connection is established. If a candidate exits from the secure browser by manually clicking the cross icon in the top right corner, they will not be able to restart the paper on the same day if their time slot has expired. However, if the time slot is still valid, the candidate can start the paper again on the same day. BU has reached out to the candidate to offer free rescheduling for candidate to resume assessment. We can close this case.

22016 • unknown • NaT • Root Cause Analysis (RCA) – Blue Screen in Secure Browser Issue Summary: Resource link was displaying a blue screen while clicking them. Initial investigation suggested that the issue was related to the internet bandwidth, but later investigation suggested a Java error. Root Cause: The secure browser relies on Java for execution, but a variable that should be cleared (or "killed") after use was persisting instead. This stale variable interfered with page rendering or authentication, leading to a failure in displaying content. Possible Causes: Memory Retention Issue – The Java application was not releasing or resetting the variable after a process completed. Session Handling Error – If the variable was linked to user sessions or authentication, it caused the browser to get stuck in an invalid state. Garbage Collection Delay – Java’s automatic memory cleanup (garbage collection) did not run at the expected time, leaving old data active. Variable Scope Issue – The variable was declared in a way that kept it alive beyond its intended use. Browser Rendering Conflict – If the stale variable was used in page rendering logic, it prevented proper loading, resulting in a blank or blue screen. Impact: The secure browser failed to load the resource links. Users were unable to access required content. Potential service disruption for users relying on this functionality. Immediate Workarounds: Cleared the cache and restarted the secure browser to check if it reset the variable. Checked for Java exceptions or errors in the logs to identify the exact point of failure. Reloaded the page in a different browser to confirm whether the issue was specific to the secure browser. Resolution & Fix Implementation: Our developers have implemented a logic fix to properly kill the old variable after its intended use. This prevents the variable from persisting and causing a blue screen. The fix has been pushed into the dev environment for testing. We will update the IHRP team by March 3 rd with

24297 • unknown • NaT • From: Ayush 🔍 Root Cause: The candidate had originally taken the test in the previous year . When the candidate applied for an upgrade or reassessment in the current year , an issue was triggered during the application process. This occurred because the system logic did not correctly handle scenarios where the year changes , resulting in an incorrect Repeater Status value. Due to this, the system assigned the wrong group to the candidate after submission, and when the candidate attempted to apply for an upgrade or reassessment, the system incorrectly displayed a “Test already attempted” message—despite the reassignment being valid. ✅ Fix: We have updated the logic to correctly validate reassignment and submission status in cross-year scenarios. This fix has been tested and verified successfully in the sandbox environment. 🧪 UAT Test Case Steps: Assign an EA or Full Paper to a candidate and have them complete the test in a previous year (e.g., 2024) to simulate a historical attempt. In 2025 , apply for an upgrade or reassessment for the same candidate. Verify that the correct test is assigned to the candidate. After submitting the new test, apply for another upgrade or reassessment to confirm the candidate can successfully reattempt, and the correct status and group are applied.

24403 • unknown • NaT • Hi @Shu Ting Ang , This is ready for deployment.
24532 • unknown • NaT • Hi @Shu Ting Ang , this ticket has been deployed successfully on 29th May 2025.
24559 • unknown • NaT • 3 June - this ticket has been deployed successfully on 29th May 2025.
25311 • unknown • NaT • Background A candidate completed an assessment in 2024 and reapplied for a reassessment in 2025. During the second application in 2025, a system error occurred, incorrectly indicating that the candidate had already taken the assessment—even though they had not done so in the current year. System Logic Issues Identified Year Change Not Handled Properly The system didn’t correctly account for the fact that the candidate’s original test was taken in a different year. This caused a misinterpretation of the candidate’s Repeater Status—a value that determines the no. of assessments taken in a year. In this instance, the candidate’s repeater status was incorrectly carried over from the previous attempt, which led the system to mistakenly mark the new entry as already completed. Incorrect Group Assignment Because of the faulty Repeater Status, the system assigned the candidate to the wrong group after submission. This group assignment is crucial for determining the assessment paper to be taken. As candidate was assigned to a previous attempt's group, assessment is automatically deemed as taken. Error Message Pop-up When the candidate tried to do her assessment, the system showed a “Test already attempted” message. This message was triggered due to the above issues, where the system believed the candidate had already taken the test, even though the assessment was valid. Deployment Date 29/05/2025

24733 • unknown • NaT • Hi Shu Ting, Please ask the candidate to add a new row of record to re-tabulate the HR experience and let us know if this resolves the issue. Please find the reply from the vendor for your reference: We investigated the issue and found that it occurs because all the experience records were created on the same day. There is a field called Total Experience, which is asynchronous and calculated by the system. When a new record is created, a plugin is triggered to update the Employment Last Update date. This update then triggers a contact flow that checks the Total Experience value. However, at that point, the system has not yet updated the Total Experience field, so its value is still 0. Since the calculation takes some time, this delay causes an incorrect value to be shown.

Problem:
While doing testing in prod, the team faced an issue where the secure browser became unresponsive after opening a PDF from the external URL and trying to download the file. \n\n-- Initial Analysis by Prometric -- \n\nThank you for bringing this to our attention.\n\nI’ve investigated the issue and identified the root cause. The behavior occurred when a PDF was opened through one of the external links within the OPEN-BOOK-TAB, and an attempt was made to download it.\n\nWhile the Secure Browser is generally capable of capturing download events within the OPEN-BOOK-TAB, this particular scenario—involving a download triggered by an externally linked PDF—is more complex and is currently not being detected by the browser.\n\nAs a result, the Secure Browser became unresponsive. Addressing this will require deeper analysis and additional development time to ensure such events can be reliably handled moving forward.\n

Problem:
Optimizations done in the secure browser by Prometric Team.\n\n1.\tRestricted Copy and Paste\n2.\tEnhanced Exception Logs: All exceptions are now meticulously logged and stored in the Documents(Local Machine) folder.\n3.\tDisabled Three-Finger Swipe (Windows): This functionality has been disabled for improved security.\n4.\tPre-Login Loader: A loader has been added before the access code page to eliminate the appearance of a white screen.\n5.\tAdmin Launch (Windows): An administrator launch option has been provided for enhanced security.\n6.\tRestrict PDF Download: When the candidate clicks on download PDF in the open book URL then the PDF will be downloaded and replaced with the ASSESSMENT TAB. So, the candidate will not have the option to back to the assessment. Candidates only have to close the secure browser and open it up again to start the paper. (A popup will be displayed if the candidate clicks to download the PDF).\n

24812 • unknown • NaT • Eunice: HI @Shu Ting Ang , Please note that this is a technical issue , stands from the lack of optimization capabilities to handle voice events detected during assessment. Please proceed to work with BU to reschedule for the candidate and recommend candidate to do her/his assessment in a room with no loud background noises if possible. Root cause: The vendor has completed a detailed review of the logs and observed that the Voice Detection (VD) events for this candidate were triggered very frequently. We are currently validating the case further, as such a high volume of VD triggers is leading to performance degradation, particularly on the candidate’s side, resulting in potential memory issues. In this candidate’s case, the unusually high frequency of VD triggers appears to have caused memory strain, which likely led to the screen freezing during submission. Regarding the two proposed solutions: Optimizing VD Handling Pros: Improves overall efficiency without limiting detection functionality; ensures smoother experience across all candidates. Cons: May require more development and testing time to roll out safely across environments. Effort: Medium to High – involves changes to detection logic and performance benchmarking. Introducing a Trigger Threshold Pros: Quick to implement; effectively prevents system overload in edge cases. Cons: May reduce the granularity of monitoring beyond the defined threshold; needs careful calibration. Effort: Low to Medium – a configuration-level update with defined impact boundaries. We are still working closely with the vendor to resolve the issue and will keep L1 posted once issue has been resolved. FYI @Muhammad Hasan please note on this.

Evidence comments (id • author_role • date • text):
24786 • unknown • NaT • Hi @Eunice Chiang Please refer to the screenshot from finance: Hi DTO Team, Could you please help confirm whether this application was cancelled by the candidate himself on 16/05/2025, as reflected in the audit history? This seems unusual as the assessment date was 14/05/2025, and our understanding is that the system should not allow candidates to cancel their applications after the assessment date. Additionally, based on the attached email from the company, candidate stated that he did not initiate the cancellation request, yet the assessment was cancelled. Appreciate your urgent clarification on what actually happened please, as this may affect the billing. Thank you.
24829 • unknown • NaT • Eunice: Hi @Shu Ting Ang Your understanding is aligned with us. We have raised this ticket to the vendor logged under . We will work closely with the vendor and keep you updated again.
24917 • unknown • NaT • Eunice: Hi @Shu Ting Ang We have concluded the investigation confirmed that the cancellation was initiated by the Candidate from the IHRP Portal. As to why candidate was able to do so, the vendor discovered that when the dashboard landing page is loading, the 'Cancel' button will lit up as the JavaScript in place takes a few moments to disable the cancel button. During this delay, if the user clicks the cancel button, the application gets cancelled. To avoid this issue and ensure a smoother user experience, we need to update the logic so that the cancel button is either hidden or disabled immediately upon page load. We will work with the vendor on this and provide an update once the fix has been deployed.

25646 • unknown • NaT • Hasan: Hi @Shu Ting Ang , We have proceeded to close this ticket and will send out an email to let L1s know how to revert to candidates when they face issues like these. Here is what we found and the solutions we will do: Context: Recently, a few candidates have encountered issues where the EA link appears in forwarded emails, even though they were not assigned EA. This discrepancy is due to how emails are rendered when forwarded. Identified Problem: Candidates may have configured email forwarding in various ways: When an email is sent to the candidate , it involves forwarding to multiple clients (e.g., Outlook and Gmail simultaneously from the candidate's end) Setting up email forwarding within the same email client Any direct forwarding of emails to any other email As a result, the competency email may display the EA link in the forwarded version, but not in the original. Next Steps: As confirmed by the vendor, this issue is not within our control, and the vendor is still exploring ways to manage such scenarios. In the meantime, please follow these steps: Ask the candidate to provide a screenshot of the competency email sent to them (must include to and from — highlighted in yellow). Verify the recipient’s email address using the screenshot, and check for any mismatch in CRM and Prometric. Check Prometric to confirm EA assignment status: ✅ If EA is assigned and the forwarded email contains the EA link → No action needed. ❌ If EA is not assigned but the forwarded email contains the EA link → Inform candidate to refer to the original email sent from donotreply@assessment.prometric.com OR refer to the version sent to the IHRP registered email address. IF emails are not delivered, you may request the L2 to ask for the delivery status of the competency email. If you need further clarification, feel free to reach out. Thank you.

Problem:
While doing testing in prod, the team faced an issue where the secure browser became unresponsive after opening a PDF from the external URL and trying to download the file.\n\n-- Initial Analysis by Prometric --\n\nThank you for bringing this to our attention.\n\nI’ve investigated the issue and identified the root cause. The behavior occurred when a PDF was opened through one of the external links within the OPEN-BOOK-TAB, and an attempt was made to download it.\n\nWhile the Secure Browser is generally capable of capturing download events within the OPEN-BOOK-TAB, this particular scenario—involving a download triggered by an externally linked PDF—is more complex and is currently not being detected by the browser.\n\nAs a result, the Secure Browser became unresponsive. Addressing this will require deeper analysis and additional development time to ensure such events can be reliably handled moving forward

Evidence comments (id • author_role • date • text):
25222 • unknown • NaT • Ready for deployment - 25/6/2025 FYI @Shu Ting Ang
25379 • unknown • NaT • Eunice: Ticket deployed on 26/6/25 Production testing results attached in Jira. Issue to be monitored: The PDF within the expandable file can be downloaded and saved locally. However, this is not a showstopper, as the candidate is accessing materials from an external site and will not be able to retrieve this source within the secure browser. Additionally, the candidate should still have access to all resources available on the site. Vendor (Ayush) has confirmed that this occurred because the ‘Save As’ window was permitted to prevent the screen from freezing in Secure Browser. As a result, restricting the download functionality is not feasible in this case, since Secure Browser cannot override the default PDF viewing behavior.

26459 • unknown • NaT • This issue has been affecting candidates since last year, where the macOS ‘Messages’ application runs in the background and interferes with the launch of the secure browser used for assessments. Our current workaround has been to instruct candidates to use the Force Quit function to terminate the application. However, we’ve recently discovered that this method does not effectively kill the ‘Messages’ process. Instead, candidates must manually open Activity Monitor, locate the ‘Messages’ process, and force quit it from there. This is not as straightforward as using a typical Task Manager and can be confusing or time-consuming for candidates, especially those unfamiliar with macOS system tools. We are raising this ticket to clarify the following with relevant business units: 1. What is the role of the ‘Messages’ process in relation to the secure browser? 2. Why does it interfere with the browser’s launch? 3. Is there a workaround or enhancement that can be implemented to prevent this issue from recurring? 4. Can the secure browser be improved to handle this process more gracefully or provide clearer guidance to candidates? Attachments and examples will be provided to support this issue.
